answers.answer: You should get your Thyroid checked.  Lots of women develop hypothyroid or under functioning thyroid while pregnant, myself included.  Go to an Endocrinologist and ask to have your TSH levels checked and an ultrasound done on the thyroid.  Your obgyn should be concerned about excessive weight gain during pregnancy which could lead to gestational (or permanent) diabetes.  Good luck!
What has your OBGYN said about the weight gain? I have gained 2 lbs so far I go to the doctor next week so we will see how much more I gained.
I am on thyroid meds:) doc is sending me to early glucose test.
Maybe your thyroid meds need to be increased? I went up around week 6 of my pregnancy.  Good luck with the glucose test...I hope you can get this figured out!
This afternoon is glucose & blood work. Ty for sharing your story. Helps :)

question: I have already gained 20lbs and I am just 16 weeks. In shock
title: omg 20lbs
